radiographic_examinations.findings: Segmental inflammation of the ileum, inflammatory thickening of the rectal and anal walls, narrowing and obstruction of the intestinal lumen, secondary colon dilation and fluid accumulation. Widespread inflammation and fistula formation in the lower segment of the rectum and perianal space, sacral anterior space, bilateral ischiorectal fossa, and gluteus maximus muscle space.

Extensive inflammation and fistula formation in the lower rectal segment and the perianal space, sacral anterior space, bilateral ischiorectal fossa, and gluteus maximus space, as well as the formation of perianal abscess.
